item.title: Terri add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "It is one of the blessings of old friends that you can afford to be stupid with them." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Terri add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Terri add a quote by St. Francis Of Assisi
item.description: "All the darkness in the world cannot extinguish the light of a single candle." -- St. Francis Of Assisi

item.title: Terri add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Women and cats will do as they please, and men and dogs should relax and get used to the idea." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Terri add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Terri add a quote by Ovid
item.description: "Chance is always powerful. Let your hook be always cast; in the pool where you least expect it, there will be a fish." -- Ovid

item.title: Terri add a quote by Yogi Berra
item.description: "Always go to other people's funerals, otherwise they won't come to yours." -- Yogi Berra

item.title: Terri add a quote by Mark Strand
item.description: "Each moment is a place you've never been." -- Mark Strand

item.title: Terri add a quote by James Joyce
item.description: "Think you're escaping and run into yourself. Longest way round is the shortest way home." -- James Joyce

item.title: Terri add a quote by Wisława Szymborska
item.description:
"When I pronounce the word Future, the first syllable already belongs to the past.
When I pronounce the word Silence, I destroy it." -- Wisława Szymborska

item.title: Terri add a quote by George Burns
item.description: "If you live to be one hundred, you've got it made. Very few people die past that age. " -- George Burns

item.title: Terri add a quote by Sir Francis Bacon
item.description: "Some books should be tasted, some devoured, but only a few should be chewed and digested thoroughly." -- Sir Francis Bacon

item.title: Terri add a quote by Peter De Vries
item.description: "Everybody hates me because I'm so universally liked." -- Peter De Vries

item.title: Terri add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Books are a uniquely portable magic." -- Stephen King

item.title: Terri add a quote by Diane Duane
item.description: "Reading one book is like eating one potato chip." -- Diane Duane

item.title: Terri add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Then the Grinch thought of something he hadn't before! What if Christmas, he thought, doesn't come from a store. What if Christmas...perhaps...means a little bit more!" -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Terri add a quote by Carl Sandburg
item.description: "Time is the coin of your life. You spend it. Do not allow others to spend it for you." -- Carl Sandburg

item.title: Terri add a quote by Susan Sontag
item.description: "My library is an archive of longings." -- Susan Sontag

item.title: Terri add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "To the well-organized mind, death is but the next great adventure." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Terri add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Terri add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Terri add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Terri add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Terri add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Terri add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: Terri add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Darkness cannot drive out darkness: only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate: only love can do that." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Terri add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Terri add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Terri add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "A day without sunshine is like, you know, night." -- Steve Martin

item.title: Terri add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Lock up your libraries if you like; but there is no gate, no lock, no bolt that you can set upon the freedom of my mind." -- Virginia Woolf
